meanings.definition: To move on foot at a moderate pace.
meanings.sent1: She walked slowly to the park.
meanings.sent2: He walked to school every day.
meanings.sent3: The turtle walked faster than the rabbit!
meanings.sent4: Time walked by as they sat on the bench.
meanings.sent5: The old man walked with a steady rhythm, like a metronome.

meanings.sent1: She walked her little sister to the bus stop.
meanings.sent2: He walked his dog in the park.
meanings.sent3: The cat walked the dog for a change!
meanings.sent4: The shadows walked alongside them in the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The loyal dog walked beside his master, never straying far.

meanings.definition: To travel on foot for exercise or leisure.
meanings.sent1: They walked along the beach, enjoying the sunset.
meanings.sent2: She walked through the forest trail for relaxation.
meanings.sent3: The penguin walked for fun on the icy slope.
meanings.sent4: The memories of childhood walked with her on every step.
meanings.sent5: The hiker walked through the valley, feeling the freedom of the open space.
